intro: Oxytropis sabzavarensis, commonly known as the Persian locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Iran and Afghanistan. The plant is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically blue to purple in color, and it produces small, hard pods that contain seeds. Oxytropis sabzavarensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils.
